concern: Also can i get a scholarship after the tryout if good enough or to get a scholarship do i already have to be in said college

dialogue_total.statement: It sounds like you're having a rough time. Can you tell me a bit more about what's been going on?
I've been feeling anxious about some college-related uncertainties. I'm trying to sort out if I qualify for certain opportunities based on my performance.

Uncertainty can be really stressful, especially when it's tied to something as important as college opportunities. It sounds like you're trying to navigate a lot of unknowns. Would you like to talk through some of your concerns?
Yes, I'd like to talk through some of my concerns to help ease my anxiety. It's been weighing on me as I navigate these college opportunities.

That's totally understandable. Uncertainty can be really draining, and it's great that you're reaching out for support. Let's start with the basics what are the specific opportunities you're concerned about qualifying for?
I'm concerned about qualifying for performance-based opportunities like scholarships at college. I'm unsure about the eligibility criteria, such as whether I need to be enrolled already.

It's completely natural to have questions about the eligibility criteria for scholarships and other performance-based opportunities. It can be confusing to navigate these requirements, especially when they differ between colleges and programs. Have you had a chance to explore the specific guidelines for the opportunities you're interested in?

I haven't thoroughly explored the specific guidelines for these opportunities yet, as I've been feeling overwhelmed by the uncertainty. I'm hoping to get some clarity on that to move forward with confidence.

It sounds like taking a closer look at the guidelines for these opportunities could help ease some of your anxiety. It's important to remember that uncertainty is a natural part of the process, and it's okay to take things one step at a time. Do you have any ideas on where you can find more information about the eligibility criteria for the scholarships you're interested in?

I think I can start by checking the university's financial aid website or contacting the scholarship office for more details. This might help me get the clarity I need on eligibility criteria to feel more confident about pursuing opportunities.

That's a great plan! Reaching out to the scholarship office or exploring the university's financial aid website can provide you with valuable information and resources to help you navigate the eligibility criteria for these opportunities. Remember, it's okay to ask for help when you need it, and seeking clarification is an important step in gaining confidence in your college journey.
I appreciate the encouragement it helps me feel more motivated to reach out. I'll definitely follow through by contacting the scholarship office to get the details I need on eligibility.

It's great to see your commitment to taking action and reaching out to the scholarship office. Remember, gaining clarity on eligibility criteria will not only help you make informed decisions but also alleviate some of the anxiety you've been experiencing. Do you have a specific timeline in mind for contacting the office, and would you like to discuss any potential barriers that may come up during this process?

I plan to contact the scholarship office by the end of this week to get the information I need. I'm open to discussing any potential barriers that might affect my efforts to understand eligibility requirements.

It's wonderful to see your commitment to contacting the scholarship office by the end of the week. Overcoming potential barriers and seeking clarity on eligibility criteria will not only help you make informed decisions but also reduce anxiety. Remember, you can always reach out for support and guidance throughout your college journey. I encourage you to follow through with your plan and wish you the best of luck. Feel free to provide updates on your progress, and don't hesitate to ask for assistance if needed.
Thanks for the encouragement I'll reach out to the scholarship office by week's end to clarify if I can get a scholarship after the tryout. I'll keep you updated if I need more help.

Great, it's been a productive conversation, and I'm glad we could address your concerns regarding college-related uncertainties and scholarships. Remember to contact the scholarship office by the end of the week to clarify eligibility criteria and keep me updated on your progress. I'm here to support you along the way, so don't hesitate to reach out if you need further assistance. Take care, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.
Thanks for your support. I'll contact the scholarship office by week's end to check on tryout eligibility and let you know how it goes.
